On Mon, 26 Jul 2004 12:09:54 -0700 (PDT), Tyler Streeter
<tylerstreeter@...> wrote:
> I still need to make a lot of improvements before this
> tool will be usable, but I'm making progress.  I've
> posted more info on the Verve website -
> www.vrac.iastate.edu/~streeter/verve/main.html,
> including two new videos that show a biped character
> starting to walk.

Pretty cool vids, Tyler.

Obviously, these guys don't have "training wheels", that is, skyhooks
keeping them from falling down.  Balance for bipedal walkers is
incredibly difficult...are you averse to putting any kind of external
helper in place?  I thought I heard you mention that you had done some
of this.

Also, how are you choosing the morphology?  The block torso seems to
swing forward, and that makes sense, since walking is mostly leaning
forward and catching yourself with your feet.  But does the ANN
controller only control the legs or also the torso joint (which
probably needs to swing back to slow the gait or stop)?

Anyway, interesting stuff...thanks for the update.

Derek
